title: conferred on it by section 6(1) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45 of
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as 

the Wireless Telegraphy 
(Liberalised Use and Related Licences in the 700 MHz Duplex, 2.1 GHz, 2.3 
GHz and 2.6 GHz Bands) (Amendment) Regulations 2022. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited wireless telegraphy (liberalised use related licence 700 mhz duplex 2.1 ghz 2.3 ghz 2.6 ghz bands) (amendment) regulation 2022 interpretation

title: conferred on it by section 6(1) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45 of
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations:
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations: 

“Principal Regulations” means the Wireless Telegraphy (Liberalised use and 
related Licences in the 700 MHz duplex, 2.1 GHz, 2.3 GHz and 2.6 GHz 
bands) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No 264 of 2021); 

(2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and that is also 
used in the Principal Regulations has, unless the context otherwise requires, the 
same meaning in these Regulations that it has in those Regulations. 

Licences to which these Regulations apply
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation principal regulation mean wireless telegraphy (liberalised use related licence 700 mhz duplex 2.1 ghz 2.3 ghz 2.6 ghz bands) regulation 2021 (s.i 264 2021) (2) word expression used regulation also used principal regulation unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation regulation licence regulation apply

title: conferred on it by section 6(1) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45 of
heading: 3. These Regulations apply to MBSA2 Liberalised Use Licences.
text_raw:
3. These Regulations apply to MBSA2 Liberalised Use Licences. 

Amendment of Regulation 2 of Principal Regulations
text_norm: 3 regulation apply mbsa2 liberalised use licence amendment regulation 2 principal regulation

title: conferred on it by section 6(1) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45 of
heading: Regulation 2(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the
text_raw:
4. 

 Regulation 2(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by the 

substitution of the following definition for the definition of “Time Slice 1”: 

“Time Slice 1” means, in relation to 2.1 GHz Band Blocks, 2.3 GHz 
Band Blocks and 2.6 GHz Band Blocks, such commencement date as 
may be specified by the Commission and ending on 11 March 2027;”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th September, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [483] 3 

Amendment of Regulation 5 of Principal Regulations

title: conferred on it by section 6(1) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45 of
heading: 5. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting the following
text_raw:
5. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting the following 

for Regulation 5(1): 

“5. (1) The commencement date of a MBSA2 Liberalised Use 
Licence shall be specified in the Licence and, in respect of 
spectrum rights of use for: 

(a) 700 MHz Duplex Blocks shall be such date as 

may be specified by the Commission; 

(b) 2.1 GHz Band Blocks, 2.3 GHz Band Blocks and

title: conferred on it by section 6(1) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45 of
heading: 2.6 GHz Band Blocks in Time Slice 2 shall be 12
text_raw:
2.6 GHz Band Blocks in Time Slice 2 shall be 12 
March 2027.”. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Commission for 
Communications Regulation, 

27 September, 2022. 

GARRETT BLANEY, 

Commissioner, For and on behalf of the Commission for 
Communications Regulation. 

The Minister for the Environment, Climate and Communications (as adapted 
by the Communications, Climate Action and Environment (Alteration of Name 
of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 373 of 2020)), in 
accordance with section 37 of the Communications Regulation Act, 2002, 
consents to the making of the foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for the 
Environment, Climate and Communications, 

26 September, 2022. 

EAMON RYAN 

Minister for the Environment, Climate and 
Communications.

title: conferred on it by section 6(1) of the Wireless Telegraphy Act 1926 (No. 45 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations prescribe matters in relation to the amendment of the 
commencement date of MBSA2 Liberalised Use Licences granted in the 2.1 
GHz Band under the Wireless Telegraphy (Liberalised Use and Related 
Licences in the 700 MHz Duplex, 2.1 GHz, 2.3 GHz and 2.6 GHz Bands) 
Regulation 2021.
